questions.question: Which result of the program is explained in the text?

choices.answer: seniors don't like to use technology
seniors learn to use snapchat
some teen tutors and seniors become friends.
seniors begin teaching others.

questions.question: Which of the following sums up the type of sensitivity training the tutors received?

choices.answer: to understand where seniors live.
to understand the physical handicaps seniors face.
to understand what seniors like to do.
to help seniors see better.

questions.question: Which of the following best shows the definition of impairments?

choices.answer: strong arms
perfect vision
poor hearing
blue eyes

questions.question: According to the text, what is the main reason teens make good tech tutors?

choices.answer: they need to complete community service hours.
the like to work with seniors
they need to learn life lessons
many of them are highly knowledgeable in using technology

questions.question: What qualities do the tech programs teach the young tutors?

choices.answer: logic, patience, sympathy
loyalty, confidence, friendship
love, patience, efficiancy
patience, sympathy, confidence

questions.question: According to the text, why do the seniors want to learn how to use technology?

choices.answer: to better communicate with teenagers
to better communicate with family who live far away.
to learn how to do all their shopping
to facetime with their friends.

questions.question: What part of speech does the suffix: "ment" create when added to a word?

choices.answer: adverb
verb
adjective
noun

questions.question: Which of the following supports the idea that special training prepares teens for the program?

choices.answer: "They get to feel what it's like to be 70, 80, 90 years old"
They understand that they have to articulate their words.
College students prep for sensitivity training.
High school seniors know how to use technology.

questions.question: According to the text, what is the main reason seniors struggle to follow written instruction?

choices.answer: They aren't able to read it.
They are unfamiliar with the special vocabulary used.
They can't find the instructions.
They don't know how to use google.

questions.question: Which of the following best sums up the central idea of the text?

choices.answer: Elders want to retire.
Teens are being recruited to teach seniors tech.
Teenagers are needing help with their studies.
Seniors want friends to teach them how to shop online.

questions.question: Combine the two sentences with a coordinating conjunction? Tommy was tired. He took a short nap

choices.answer: Tommy took a nap, and he was tired.
Tommy took a nap because he was tired.
Tommy wanted a nap and he was tired.
Tommy was tired, so he took a short nap.

questions.question: Which of the following does the acronym FANBOYS stand for?

choices.answer: for, ace, not, bet, so
fan, and, yet, but, no, or, still
fill, and, yet, boy, no, order, stale
for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so

questions.question: The word achieve means to accomplish What does the word achievement mean?

choices.answer: the process of accomplishing a task
the reason for accomplishing a task
the result of accomplishing a task
the beginning of accomplishing a task.

questions.question: Which of the following italicized words is a coordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: Teens must be patient when working with seniors.
The senior was having a problem, so the teen tutor helped.
The senior was having an issue.
The teen tutor helped the senior with the technology.

questions.question: Which of the following best uses a coordinating conjunction to combine the sentences?

choices.answer: Mr. Lee could email, for he also asked his son questions.
Mr. Lee could read, so he also asked his son questions.
Mr. Lee could email, or he also asked his son questions.
Mr. Lee could read, but he also asked his son questions.

questions.question: Which of the following contain only subordinating conjunctions?

choices.answer: She, He, I
after, as, because
silently, quietly
caught, catch
